text: Station is the term for a big agricultural property (owned land) that is used for raising livestock. The word is used in Australian and New Zealand English. The owner of a station is called a grazier. They are also sometimes called pastoralists. Its workers are called stockmen. The stations may be called sheep stations or cattle stations, depending on what type of animal it raises. ==Related pages== *Ranch ==References== Category:Agriculture in Australia Category:Australian culture Category:Farms
title: Station (agriculture)
